member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Assets.CuttingTool.LifeType.WEAR
member.summary: The tool life measured in tool wear. Wear MUST be provided in millimeters as an offset to nominal. All units for minimum, maximum, and nominal MUST be given as millimeter offsets as well.

member.name: T:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Cryptography.ConfigurationDecrypter
member.summary: Please see for a summary of how encryption works

member.name: M:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Cryptography.ConfigurationDecrypter.Decrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts the incoming cyphertext
member.param: Content to be decrypted
member.returns: Decrypted version of the provided text

member.name: T:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Cryptography.ConfigurationEncrypter
member.summary:
A QUICK OVERVIEW OF ENCRYPTION RSA can only encrypt strings up to a certain length "Messages must not be longer than the N of the public key." To get around this, we instead use two step encryption. Rijndael is a symmetric encryption method that can encrypt a string of any length. We will use Rijndael to encrypt the input string. We then encrypt the single use Rijndael key with RSA. We store this key, Rijndael Initialization Vector, the certificate we used to encrypt with's thumbprint and the Rijndael encrypted data in a Base64 string. This string can then be used in the place of the original data.
Using this method, we can encrypt a string of any length asymmetrically.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Cryptography.ConfigurationEncrypter.Encrypt(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Encrypts the provided
member.param: Location of the secret certificate
Content to be encrypted
member.returns: Encrypted version of the provided text

member.summary: Decrypts the provided encrypted text.
member.param: Encrypted text
member.returns: Task for decrypting the provided text
